ygData.subject: Re: Role Playing
ygData.msgSnippet: I m with you on this issue... its funny when someone is upset that a low level necro wants some compensation for finding a corpse.  or magic users wishing for
ygData.messageBody:
I'm with you on this issue... its funny when someone is upset that a low
level necro wants some compensation for finding a corpse.� or magic users
wishing for something in return of�bind.� I just feel that's its part of the
game..� and all magic users know spells are not cheap :)� we need help in
the beginning...� :)� hehe...���� My fellow magic users are complaining that
they cant find some spells and feel that they are were left out of the game
( which means immediately post vulgarities to anyone wishing to help them )
later only to find that its there, just in certain cities.. they need only
explore the game further.. i know that some spells are not working correctly
but its not worth hating someone else for it... :)

-----Original Message-----
From: Shane Bole [mailto:shane0009@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 3:13 PM
To: EverQuest@onelist.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Role Playing


thats true.. but this game was meant to be an RPG and you find people
running around twinking or overcharging for their services or making
characters just for selling crap instead of /auctioning. ive seen some of
these people, it pisses me off. this is a RPG, not some stupid place you run
around greedy ripping people off. They disrespect necromancers, not through
the character, but in their own words. that is not right and I believe its
called necrobashing..? its hard to play them now with everyone giving you bs
dueling you all the time

----- Original Message -----
From: Whitmore, Lance
To: 'EverQuest@onelist.com'
Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 3:01 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Role Playing


You just have to face it.. everybody wants everything today. Its just a
representation of soceity and the culture we live in.� I myself look at them
sometimes when i feel im stuck.� The problem is though is.. during the game
people /ooc or /shout out for solutions and people are so quick to give them
the answer to any question. Unfortutely the answer is right there i cant
block it out I can remove it from my mind.� I just wish that people would
try to keep some mystery to the game, and i know i can just filter out
Shouts and Out of Characters but... i shouldnt have to do that to enjoy the
game.� Everyone just wants a hand out.. :)

-----Original Message-----
From: Shane Bole [ mailto:shane0009@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 2:03 PM
To: EverQuest@onelist.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Role Playing


From: "Shane Bole" <shane0009@...>

this is pretty lame... this is an RPG, but on all the polls, people want
walkthroughs on quests? where is the fun in that? maybe a hint or 2, but its

no fun walking around following a guide telling you to avoid so and so
whatever to not get killed.
just wondering if anyone aggrees with this...
